metadata.title: CVE-2016-5773 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
php_zip.c in the zip extension in PHP before 5.5.37, 5.6.x before 5.6.23,and 7.x before 7.0.8 improperly interacts with the unserializeimplementation and garbage collection, which allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (use-after-free andapplication crash) via crafted serialized data containing a ZipArchiveobject.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5773` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
